decks.notes: This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base while ramping up its own resources using Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. The primary win condition is through powerful mid-range threats like Inferno Titan and Bloodbraid Elf. Blood Moon and Stone Rain are used to further disrupt the opponent, while cards like Tireless Tracker and Courser of Kruphix provide card advantage and resilience. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Molten Rain, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Birds of Paradise and Pia and Kiran Nalaar.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through the deck using cards like Street Wraith and Monstrous Carabid to fill the graveyard. The goal is to cast Living End, bringing back powerful creatures like Archfiend of Ifnir and Desert Cerodon from the graveyard while simultaneously wiping the opponents board. This combo can happen as early as turn 2 with the help of cards like Demonic Dread and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck also includes ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as using Fulminator Mage to destroy lands.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to either win the game with Ad Nauseam or with Lightning Storm. The deck utilizes cards like Pentad Prism and Lotus Bloom to ramp up mana quickly, along with cantrips like Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions for consistency. Angel's Grace and Ad Nauseam are key components of drawing through the deck and setting up the win condition. Pact of Negation is used for protection while Laboratory Maniac provides an alternate win condition. The deck also includes lands that can help generate mana and filter draws efficiently.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells in the early game. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Gemstone Caverns and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Eldrazi Mimic to put pressure on the opponent. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Dismember provide additional disruption and removal, while Eternal Scourge and Matter Reshaper offer resilience and card advantage. Overall, the deck's strategy is to deploy a fast and aggressive board presence to quickly close out the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana and card draw through spells like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Baral, Chief of Compliance to enable a powerful combo with Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens for a high amount of damage. The deck also utilizes cards like Gifts Ungiven and Past in Flames to set up key pieces of the combo. The inclusion of Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional card advantage and control elements to help protect the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while generating a board presence with Young Pyromancer and Lingering Souls. The deck aims to control the game with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command, eventually overwhelming the opponent with a large board of tokens and powerful creatures like Bedlam Reveler. The inclusion of Blood Moon helps to further disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving the deck an additional edge in the matchup.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying multiple artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to pump them up, allowing for aggressive attacks. The deck also includes burn spells like Galvanic Blast for direct damage. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive board presence and the ability to buff creatures for lethal swings. The inclusion of cards like Etched Champion and Vault Skirge provide resilience against removal spells. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through a combination of creature aggression and burn damage.

This deck focuses on quickly emptying your hand and bringing out powerful creatures like Hollow One, Flamewake Phoenix, and Gurmag Angler. With strong discard and cycling effects, you aim to overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of aggressive threats early in the game. By efficiently using your resources and graveyard recursion, you can maintain pressure on your opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. This fast-paced, all-in strategy can catch opponents off guard and secure victories in the blink of an eye.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively flood the board with low-cost creatures like Hollow One and Flameblade Adept while quickly cycling through your deck with cards like Faithless Looting and Goblin Lore. By discarding cards and playing cards like Burning Inquiry, you can trigger powerful effects like bringing back Bloodghast from the graveyard or casting Flamewake Phoenix from exile. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression, card advantage, and graveyard recursion to quickly close out the game.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of artifact creatures and using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to power them up with Cranial Plating. Contested War Zone provides additional damage output, while Welding Jar and Chalice of the Void offer protection against removal spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing cards like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest to chip away at the opponent's life total. With efficient creatures like Myr Enforcer and Arcbound Ravager, the deck seeks to close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main strategy of this deck is to aggressively play creatures that can be easily cast for free or reduced cost, such as Hollow One, Vengevine, and Flamewake Phoenix. By utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Goblin Lore to discard cards quickly, the deck can take advantage of these powerful creatures early in the game. Additionally, cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary provide additional burst damage to quickly overwhelm the opponent. This deck aims to create a fast, aggressive board presence and apply pressure to the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans while maintaining card advantage and board control. It uses a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the tempo of the game. The deck aims to control the board through cards like Path to Exile, Detention Sphere, and Supreme Verdict, while also generating card advantage with Search for Azcanta and Sphinx's Revelation. The win conditions include Celestial Colonnade, Vendilion Clique, and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a board of aggressive Human creatures with the help of cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben slows down opponents, while Meddling Mage disrupts their game plan. Phantasmal Image and Reflector Mage provide versatility and interaction, while Champion of the Parish grows stronger with each Human ally. Mantis Rider and Kitesail Freebooter offer flying threats and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and resilient swarm of Human creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with key cards like Life from the Loam, Faithless Looting, and Conflagrate. By dredging cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, the deck aims to bring back creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast from the graveyard, allowing for explosive combo plays. Utilizing cards like Narcomoeba and Insolent Neonate for additional graveyard interactions, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a continuous stream of creatures and burn spells.

The main focus of this red aggro deck is to deal quick and efficient damage to the opponent. By utilizing low-cost burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Searing Blaze, along with creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the goal is to consistently chip away at the opponent's life total and overwhelm them before they can establish a strong defense. The deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game, using cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of the deck is to control the board through counterspells and removal spells, while using card draw to set up powerful combo plays with cards like Through the Breach and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. Blood Moon is included to disrupt opponent's mana base, while cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck aims to stall the game until it can cast Emrakul, either cheating it into play with Through the Breach or hardcasting it with enough mana.
